episodes.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released under investigation | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
Adam, Alex Forsyth, Joe Pike and pollster Luke Tryl look back at the week in Westminster; starting with Thursday morning's news that the King’s brother, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, had been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in a public office.  

Plus, they discuss the appointment of Antonia Romeo to the role of cabinet secretary and our first look at Reform UK’s new economic policy.

Andrew has previously denied wrongdoing in relation to Epstein; he has not responded to the BBC’s requests for comment on any of the specific allegations in relation to the release of millions of Epstein files in January.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Andrew #Royals #BBCNews

00:00 Introduction
01:05 Andrew's arrest
12:17 Peter Mandelson's company on brink of collapse
13:54 Antonia Romeo appointed as cabinet secretary
21:44 BREAKING Andrew released under investigation
22:33 What are Robert Jenrick's new economic policies for Reform?

episodes.title: Epstein Files: The Gordon Brown Intervention
episodes.description:
Former Prime Minister Gordon Brown has told the BBC the situation facing Sir Keir Starmer is "serious" and suggested he may have been "too slow to do the right things" concerning Lord Mandelson.

He also defended him as "a man of integrity" who "wants to do the right things".

He spoke to the Today programme on Radio 4 in his first interview since the latest Epstein files seemed to show Lord Mandelson gave Epstein advance notice of a €500bn bailout by the EU to save the ailing Euro in 2010.

Another included a 2009 memo in which Brown's policy adviser Nick Butler wrote about the UK's struggling economy and recommended selling off government-held assets to raise public funds.

Brown said this was "market-sensitive" information as people can make money from changes in the values of currencies.

Lord Mandelson has not given the BBC an official statement but his position is that he has not acted in any way criminally and that he was not motivated by financial gain.

episodes.title: How are the King and the prime minister responding to the Epstein files? | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
Today, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer faces further questions about his judgement in appointing Peter Mandelson as US ambassador, and there is a darkening mood among Labour MPs.  

Adam, Chris, Alex Forsyth and Daniela Relph discuss how the continuing revelations from the Epstein Files have created challenges for both the Royal Family and the government; and the different approaches taken by the King and the prime minister.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

episodes.title: Keir Starmer apologises for hiring Mandelson, but can he survive as prime minister? | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
Today, the UK prime minister has apologised to victims of Jeffrey Epstein for appointing Peter Mandelson as US ambassador and “believing his lies”.

Adam is joined by Henry in Westminster with Ailbhe Rea from the New Statesman and Luke Sullivan, Keir Starmer’s former political director, to break down where the Mandelson affair leaves the prime minister.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews #EpsteinFiles #ukpolitics

episodes.title: Why are the police investigating Peter Mandelson after the release of Epstein files? | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
The Metropolitan Police has launched a criminal investigation into Peter Mandelson after new files released seemed to suggest he had passed sensitive government information to Jeffrey Epstein. 

Lord Mandelson has resigned from the House of Lords following the latest revelations, though he retains the right to use the title of Lord.

The government says it is moving to draft legislation that will strip him of his title and the opposition are expected to try and force the government to release papers relating to Mandelson’s hiring as US ambassador. 

Adam and Chris are joined by Dominic Casciani, BBC home affairs correspondent and Daniela Relph who has the latest on seeming revelations about Sarah Ferguson.

episodes.title: What more is in the Epstein files, and why has Mandelson been reported to the police? | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
The Metropolitan Police say they are reviewing allegations of misconduct in a public office after new files suggest Peter Mandelson sent government information to Jeffrey Epstein.

Lord Mandelson seemingly forwarded internal emails sent and received while he was business secretary in 2009 from senior politicians to Epstein. 

Adam is joined by political correspondent Joe Pike in Westminster to discuss the latest allegations and senior royal correspondent Daniela Relph to discuss new revelations relating to emails seemingly sent to Epstein by Sarah Ferguson, former Duchess of York. 

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews #UKnews #EpsteinFiles

00:00 What's in the new files and how does the BBC report on them?

03:38 Jeffrey Epstein speaks in an interview

05:58 New revelations about Peter Mandelson 

13:50 New revelations about Sarah Ferguson

14:20 The reaction

episodes.title: Epstein Files: New Mandelson and Andrew Allegations | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
A second woman is alleging that she was sent to the UK by Jeffrey Epstein for a sexual encounter with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor following the release of more documentation from the Epstein files.

The encounter allegedly occurred at the former prince's residence, Royal Lodge, in 2010.

BBC News has asked Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor for comment, but so far he has not responded to these accusations.

Laura, Paddy and Henry discuss the story and what it could mean for victims.

And John Bew, a professor, historian and former chief foreign policy adviser to four prime ministers, is in the studio to talk about what Trump might do in Iran, Ukraine, UK defence, and his time in Downing Street.

episodes.title: The Peter Mandelson Interview
episodes.description: Since Peter Mandelson's sacking as US ambassador over his links to the convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, he's remained silent, until now. In this extended version of this first and exclusive interview, Laura's questions him over Trump, Epstein, and what Number 10 really knew. Laura, Paddy, and Henry will be in your feed with analysis later as normal.

episodes.title: Has the Andrew Saga Changed the Relationship Between Parliament and the Palace?
episodes.description:
Today, we discuss how the saga the led to Prince Andrew becoming Andrew Mountbatten Windsor might have led to a shift in the relationship between politicians and the Palace.
Pressure is also mounting on Andrew from politicians in the US as members of a congressional committee investigating the Jeffrey Epstein case have intensified their calls for Andrew to answer questions about his links to the late sex offender.
Alex steps in for Paddy who’s away.

episodes.title: Why King Charles decided to strip Andrew of his title of ‘Prince’ | BBC Newscast
episodes.description:
Buckingham Palace has announced it has stripped Andrew of his title of “Prince”. 

He will be now known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor - effective immediately. He will also have to leave his official residence, the Royal Lodge.

Adam is joined by Victoria Derbyshire, Newsnight Presenter and BBC Royal Correspondent Daniela Relph. 

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

episodes.title: The Virginia Giuffre Memoir And Prince Andrew
episodes.description: Today, we discuss the allegations made in Virginia Giuffre’s memoir against Prince Andrew. Virginia Giuffre passed away in April after taking her own life, but finished writing the book before her death. The book goes into detail about the allegations she has made against Jeffrey Epstein, Prince Andrew and Ghislaine Maxwell. Prince Andrew denies all of the allegations made against him, but gave up his royal titles on Friday. What does Giuffre say in the book, and how have the Royal Family responded? Adam is joined in the studio with BBC Newsnight presenter Victoria Derbyshire, and BBC royal correspondent Daniela Relph. You can now listen to Newscast on a smart speaker.
